speaker: Outstanding Directorial Achievement in a Comedy Series
text: Pamela Fryman  EMMY
nextSpeaker: Outstanding Cinematography for a Multi-Camera Series

speaker: Outstanding Cinematography for a Multi-Camera Series
text: Ken Lamkin  * * *  ## Transcript {david langley}    _PROLOGUE  Scenes from "Something Borrowed, Someone Blue":  Niles announcing his elopement in Frasier's apartment. "PREVIOUSLY ON FRASIER" at the bottom of the screen._
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Directorial Achievement in a Comedy Series

speaker: Niles
text: It occurred to me I think perhaps we should try to keep this quiet from Daphne.
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Cinematography for a Multi-Camera Series

speaker: Daphne
text: Keep what quiet? *******

speaker: Mel
text: We got married!

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, are you saying you have feelings for Niles?

speaker: Daphne
text: I think I do.

speaker: Martin
text: You can't tell Niles all this, he says he's happy with Mel.

speaker: Frasier
text: She says she's happy with Donny.  But I'm not sure I believe either one of them. *******

speaker: Martin
text: Just remember, Fras: there are two marriages on the line here.

speaker: Niles
text: I will get a divorce and you can call off the wedding.

speaker: Daphne
text: I can't!  Donny is a dear and wonderful man, and I made a promise to him. *******

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm sorry, my mind's made up.

speaker: Daphne
text: I was wondering...if you might be free for a date?

speaker: Niles
text: [_rushing to embrace her_] Oh, my God, yes!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_separating them_] There's plenty of time for that later, let's get this bloody boat moving!  _Act 1  Scene 1 - The Winnebago  Fade in.  Niles is driving the Winnebago, Daphne in the passenger seat beside him.  They are both giddy._

speaker: Niles
text: I can't believe this!

speaker: Daphne
text: Neither can I!

speaker: Niles
text: What made you change your mind?

speaker: Daphne
text: My little niece, Audrey, the flower girl.  She looked up at me and said "You're the saddest bride I've ever seen."  I figured who was I kidding if I couldn't fool a four-year-old with an eye patch?

speaker: Niles
text: Remind me to give her a car for her preschool graduation.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_laughing_] The next thing I knew, I was climbing out the window of the loo!

speaker: Niles
text: You mean...you didn't tell Donny?

speaker: Daphne
text: I didn't tell anyone.  Can't you get this thing moving any faster?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I would, but we have to watch out for speed...

speaker: Niles
text: ...bumps.

speaker: Daphne
text: I've never done anything this crazy!  Are you nervous?

speaker: Niles
text: Only that I'm gonna wake up. _Daphne gazes at him lovingly.  Niles's cell phone rings and he reaches for it._

speaker: Daphne
text: Don't answer it!  It's probably your brother wondering if you've seen me.

speaker: Niles
text: Maybe it's Mel wondering why it's taking me half an hour to put on insect repellant.

speaker: Niles
text: Good.

speaker: Niles
text: Here we are: the end of the driveway.  Which way shall we go?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, to the right is Seattle, and to the left I guess, is Canada.

speaker: Niles
text: Any thoughts?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, what's left for us in Seattle?  Ex-wives, an ex-fiance... a tangled mess of bitterness and hurt feelings.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, but an excellent symphony and world-class dining.

speaker: Daphne
text: Then there's Canada: a fresh start, a chance for adventure.

speaker: Niles
text: [_looking that way_] Grizzly bears.

speaker: Daphne
text: I don't care!  Just pick one, let's go!

speaker: Niles
text: [_reaching for the phone_] Maybe we should just...

speaker: Daphne
text: No!  We can't think about that.  I just ran out on my wedding, I can't go back.  I need you to be strong.

speaker: Niles
text: For you, I have the strength of Hercules. _He leans over to kiss her, but is caught short by the seat belt. He struggles against it for a moment as she looks confused, then blows her a kiss._

speaker: Niles
text: I love you.

speaker: Daphne
text: And I love you.

speaker: Daphne
text: They're not going away, are they?

speaker: Niles
text: If you want to keep going, I'll go.

speaker: Daphne
text: No.  We better go back and face the music.  We should make things right.

speaker: Niles
text: OK.

speaker: Niles
text: All right, all right, we're on our way back!  Excuse me? ...No, there is no Wendel Fong here.

speaker: Daphne
text: This is gonna be friggin' awful!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, maybe.  Maybe not.

speaker: Niles
text: Sometimes you build these things up in your mind, and they turn out not half as bad as you thought.

speaker: Daphne
text: That being said, I guess there's no easy way to tell you this: I'm in love with Niles, and I can't marry you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Donny, are you all right?  _The view fades out as he faints.  There is the noise of something hitting the ground and a grunt._

speaker: Daphne
text: Donny!

speaker: Niles
text: Mel, did you hear what I just said?  Say something.  Anything.  _There is a bloodcurdling scream.  Niles looks around frantically and makes shushing motions._ _SMASH CUT TO: Frasier's BMW. Frasier is driving down the road, Martin in the passenger seat, both looking grim.  Niles and Daphne are in the back seat, looking shell-shocked._

speaker: Niles
text: [_stunned_] Wow.  _FADE OUT.  Scene 2 - Frasier's BMW Everything as before._

speaker: Daphne
text: [_stunned_] Wow.

speaker: Martin
text: Anyone try those little crab cakes? [_off Frasier's look_] What?  They were good.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, Dad!  We just had front row seats for what is arguably the most disastrous wedding in history.  Can't just ignore it with a lot of inane chit chat.

speaker: Niles
text: Did you try that mustard dip that went with them?  It was good.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Frankly, I prefer a little inane chit chat to talking about what actually happened back there.

speaker: Daphne
text: Poor Donny.  I've never seen him so upset.  I just wish I'd broken the news to him in a carpeted room instead of the rock garden.  I just can't help feeling that our happiness has come at the expense of Mel and Donny.

speaker: Martin
text: There was no easy way out of this.  But you guys did the right thing coming back.  I'm proud of you both.

speaker: Niles
text: Thanks Dad.  And... thank you, Frasier.  As painful as it was back there, we owe you a debt of gratitude.  Daphne and I are here now because of you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Please, Niles, I really didn't do all that much.  Just a minor pluck of Cupid's bow.

speaker: Daphne
text: Nonsense.  You set this whole thing in motion.

speaker: Frasier
text: Stop it.  I'm blushing!  Just seeing you two kids together is thanks enough for me.  Although I, I wouldn't turn down a bottle of '82 Latour.

speaker: Niles
text: [_sotto voce to Daphne_] He's not kidding.

speaker: Daphne
text: I know.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, look.  Isn't that my Winnebago pulling out from the gas station?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'd say so.  You know, Dad, I'm amazed you let Simon drive that thing.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, it'll be fine.  I gave him a lecture about drinking and driving.

speaker: Frasier
text: He did understand you were discouraging it?

speaker: Martin
text: [_laughing_] Of course. [_He looks thoughtful for a moment._] Uh-oh.

speaker: Daphne
text: Just hope he gets my family to the airport on time. I wouldn't want them to miss their plane, if you get my drift.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, it's them all right.  Look, it's all your brothers waving from the back.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, how ya doin'?

speaker: Niles
text: Hello.

speaker: Martin
text: See ya!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, well that's very nice.  Ugh...

speaker: Frasier
text: Living up to the "Moon" family name, I see.   **IF THEY'D GIVEN CASH HE'D BE IN CABO BY NOW**  _Scene 3 - Frasier's Apartment Fade in.  Daphne and Roz are wrapping boxes, Martin is eating breakfast._

speaker: Daphne
text: So did Simon get you home all right after dropping my family at the airport?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, yeah.  He entertained the whole neighborhood trying to parallel park the Winnebago.  The highlight was when he flattened a whole row of newspaper racks.

speaker: Martin
text: How many did he get?  My record's five.

speaker: Daphne
text: I suppose he followed that up with some sort of clumsy advance.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, he tried, but I told him to get lost.  Then he hit on my babysitter!  She showed him why she's the star of her JV soccer team.

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, Mum claims he was dropped as a child.  I think he was thrown. [_they laugh_] I can't thank you enough for helping me return these wedding gifts.  I've been dreading it.  Just reminds me of how many people I've disappointed.

speaker: Martin
text: Daph, you really outdid yourself on these corn muffins today. They're light... moist... corny...

speaker: Daphne
text: [_to Roz_] He's just being so sweet to me because of all of this.

speaker: Martin
text: No, I mean it!  They're delicious!

speaker: Daphne
text: He hates 'em.  Watch this. [_to him_] You know, if you finish those up, I'll make another batch.  In fact, I'll fill the freezer and we'll have them with every meal.

speaker: Martin
text: All right, all right, I give!  Try to do something nice around here.  _He tosses the rest of the muffin to Eddie.  Simon comes in the front carrying a couple of gifts._

speaker: Simon
text: Right, that's the last of it.  Look sharp, Daphne! _He tosses a gift, which bounces off the arm of the couch and falls to the floor with a shattering sound._

speaker: Daphne
text: Simon, you idiot!

speaker: Simon
text: Oh, don't get your knickers in a twist, I already dropped it in the elevator.

speaker: Daphne
text: I think you've helped enough for one day.

speaker: Martin
text: Simon, how about a little breakfast?

speaker: Simon
text: Oh, no thanks, Marty.  I've already had a lovely crispy golden waffle and a foamy cappuccino down in the Winnebago.

speaker: Martin
text: The Winnebago?  That doesn't have a waffle iron or a cappuccino maker.

speaker: Daphne
text: Wait a minute, these gifts look like they've been unwrapped and then wrapped again.  Simon!

speaker: Simon
text: You know what that is, Daphne?  That's a bread maker, which you did not register for.  Some people are so bloody thoughtless.

speaker: Daphne
text: That's stealing!  These gifts are going back!

speaker: Simon
text: Never!  Returning used merchandise is unethical.  And I for one will never be party to it.  _Daphne opens the door, it is Niles.  They move to kiss each other, but, noticing the others staring, don't quite connect._

speaker: Niles
text: So... returning wedding presents, I take it.  That's one problem Mel and I avoided by eloping.  No presents to return when, uh... when, uh...

speaker: Simon
text: When you shag someone else's wife?

speaker: Daphne
text: Simon!

speaker: Daphne
text: Would you like some coffee?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I'd love some.  Here, let me help.

speaker: Niles
text: Ooh, Dad, those look good.  What are they?  _He reaches for a corn muffin as Martin checks to see that Daphne is out of earshot._

speaker: Martin
text: Doorstops.

speaker: Niles
text: [_pulling his hand back_] Thank you.  _He hurries on into the kitchen.  Reset to: the kitchen as he enters. Daphne turns and they embrace and kiss tenderly._

speaker: Niles
text: How'd you sleep last night?

speaker: Daphne
text: I didn't.  How 'bout you?

speaker: Niles
text: Not a wink.  Um, you know, as pleasant as it was riding up and down that driveway yesterday, I, I think it hardly qualifies as a date, so I have a surprise for you.  I made reservations for tonight at Au Pied du Cochon, and after, we're going dancing at the Starlight Room.  It'll be our first official date.  You free?

speaker: Daphne
text: Wow, this is awfully short notice.  Can I get back to you?

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah, of course.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_laughing_] Of course I'm free, ya silly sausage.  It sounds wonderful!

speaker: Niles
text: Um, uh, Daphne, uh...  About us.  I, uh, think we shouldn't rush into anything, like living together, or, or even... physical relations until I have the situation resolved with Mel.  You have any thoughts about that?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I'm so relieved.  I feel exactly the same way.  We need to get to know each other in this whole new light first.

speaker: Niles
text: We're completely simpatico.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes. _Daphne turns back to the counter.  Niles grimaces, clenches his fists and waves his arms in a tantrum, finally sighing and letting his shoulders slump in resignation._

speaker: Daphne
text: Although, you know,  in some respects, we're much further ahead than most couples.  I already know how you take your coffee.  Cream.

speaker: Niles
text: Mm-hmm.

speaker: Daphne
text: One sugar.

speaker: Niles
text: Mm-hmm.  And two lips.

speaker: Frasier
text: Morning.

speaker: Niles
text: [_breaking the kiss_] Good morning.  No, I don't see anything in your eye.

speaker: Frasier
text: For God's sake, I got news for you: the cat is out of the bag!

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I'm sorry.  I guess I'm just not used to kissing the boss's brother in the kitchen. [_nervous_] Not that I'm used to kissing him any other place. [_laughing_] I mean any other room...

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, Daphne, I know what you mean!  So, how are you two doing?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, well we're deliriously happy, of course.  Although, I, I keep thinking about Mel and how she must be feeling today. _Niles's cell phone rings, he pulls it out and goes to the back of the kitchen._

speaker: Niles
text: Excuse me.

speaker: Daphne
text: Poor Donny.  He must be devastated.  I'll never forgive myself for that.  Maybe I should go and see him.

speaker: Frasier
text: I wouldn't, Daph.  You know, Donny and Mel have suffered a terrible blow.  They'll need space and time to lick their wounds.  Believe me, in the emotional state they're in, the last thing they'll want is to speak with either of you.

speaker: Niles
text: [_into phone_] Hold on.  Frasier, could you hold it down? It's Mel.

speaker: Frasier
text: That woman never misses an opportunity to show me up!

speaker: Roz
text: Daphne, Simon is opening your gifts.

speaker: Daphne
text: Bloody hell!  _She rushes to the living room.  Reset to: the living room as she hurries over to Simon and grabs the present._

speaker: Daphne
text: Simon, give me that!

speaker: Simon
text: Roz, you little snitch!   You know, I'm starting to have serious doubts about whether you're gonna be the future mother of my children.

speaker: Roz
text: Somewhere out there, the future mother of your children just lifted her head from a puddle of drool.

speaker: Simon
text: Yeah, but I'll bet she's got a ripper body.

speaker: Messenger
text: Daphne Moon?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes.

speaker: Messenger
text: [_handing her flowers_] These are for you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, goodness!

speaker: Messenger
text: [_handing her some papers_] And so is this.  Consider yourself served.

speaker: Daphne
text: What?!  _The messenger leaves as Daphne looks at the papers.  Niles comes in from the kitchen with the coffee._

speaker: Niles
text: Well, you won't believe this: Mel insists on seeing me. [_noticing Daphne_] Wow.  Wonderful flowers, who are they from?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I can't read the card from here, but I'd say they're from Donny.

speaker: Niles
text: Is he trying to get you back?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, he's getting me back, all right.  He's suing me!

speaker: Niles
text: [_crossing to Daphne_] What?

speaker: Simon
text: Call me crazy, but you know what I think we all need right now?  A nice pot of fondue.  I'm sure I seen one in here somewhere. _He begins rummaging through the gifts as Roz tries to stop him. FADE OUT.  End of Act 1  Act 2_ **GUESS WHO'S SHORT, WEARS A TUXEDO AND HAS FROSTING ALL OVER HIS FEET?** _Scene 1 - Donny's Office Fade in.  Frasier knocks, then enters Donny's office, which is dark._

speaker: Frasier
text: Donny?  Are you in here?

speaker: Donny
text: Hi, Fras. _Donny's voice comes from his chair, which is turned with its back to Frasier.  He speaks in the careful sing-song of a heavily-medicated man._

speaker: Frasier
text: It's kind of dark in here.  You think maybe we could turn on the light?

speaker: Donny
text: OK.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, OK. [_He turns the lights on._] There we go, that's better. Ah... Donny?  You're gonna have to turn around.  I can't see you.

speaker: Donny
text: Well, we can't see you either.

speaker: Frasier
text: We?

speaker: Donny
text: Oh, that's right, you haven't met my little friend. _He swivels around.  He's dressed in the shirt from his wedding clothes, and unshaven.  He holds up a little plastic groom._

speaker: Donny
text: You remember him?  From the top of the wedding cake?  I call him "Mr. Chump."  Say hello to Mr. Chump.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, Donny...

speaker: Donny
text: I said say hello!

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Mr. Chump.  Donny, are you all right?

speaker: Donny
text: Oh, yeah.  I wasn't feeling very well yesterday, but the doctor gave me a few pills and I'm feeling much better now. So, what can I do for you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, before I get to that, Donny, I'd like you to know that my visit here was completely my own idea.  Daphne has nothing to do with it.  What happened to you yesterday was unforgivable... and devastating.  I know whereof I speak.  You see, I too was once... abandoned at the altar.  You're feeling abandoned and hurt, and completely alone.

speaker: Donny
text: Aren't you forgetting someone?

speaker: Frasier
text: Just so we're clear: All my remarks refer to human relationships.

speaker: Donny
text: Well...

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne realizes you went to great expense for this wedding, and she is prepared to repay you over time, but Donny, this hundred thousand dollars in punitive damages for emotional distress; that's not you.  That's not the Donny Douglas I know.

speaker: Donny
text: It's not?

speaker: Frasier
text: No. You don't want to sue Daphne.

speaker: Donny
text: I'm a lawyer, it's my natural impulse.  Oh, you know, maybe I am being too hard on Daphne.  In all fairness, she's not totally to blame.

speaker: Frasier
text: Gosh, there's plenty of blame to go around.  I mean, even I played a minor part in these events.

speaker: Donny
text: [_sitting up_] You?  I was talking about me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you, me, everyone.  Let he who is without sin, right? Anyway, I'm glad we had this talk. God bless.

speaker: Donny
text: No, wait, wait, wait, wait...just a minute.  What "minor part" did you play?

speaker: Frasier
text: I may have mentioned in passing to Niles and Daphne how they felt about each other.  Which may have, conceivably, set this ...whole thing in motion.  Perhaps!

speaker: Donny
text: You did this on my wedding day?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no.  No, Donny, no.  It was the night before, but... what I'm trying to say is if you feel the urge to yell at someone, well then yell at me.  If you want to take a swing at someone, then here's my chin. [_Donny jumps up._] Are you going to hit me?

speaker: Donny
text: Oh, yeah.  I'm gonna hit you.  I'm gonna hit you with tortious interference and intentional and negligent infliction of emotional distress.  In layman's terms: I'm gonna sue your ass off!

speaker: Frasier
text: Me?!  But Daphne's the one who left you at the altar!

speaker: Donny
text: That's right.  That's why I'm suing her for breach of contract!

speaker: Frasier
text: Donny, Donny listen, you're being emotional right now.  Give this a few days and I'm sure you'll feel much better.

speaker: Donny
text: Actually, I'm feeling a lot better, thank you Frasier.  Suing you is just the tonic I needed.  You know what else?  I'm starving.  I haven't eaten in twenty-four hours.  I'd ask you to join me, but, uh, you should be saving your money.  Turn out the lights when you leave.  Oh, by the way, Fras.  Who's Mr. Chump now? _He puts the plastic figure in Frasier's pocket, then turns and leaves. FADE OUT.  Scene 2 - Cafe Nervosa Fade in.  Martin and Niles are sitting at the table by the window._

speaker: Niles
text: Where is Mel?  That woman is punctual to a fault.  This is a bad sign.

speaker: Martin
text: She's only five minutes late.

speaker: Niles
text: Five?!  I thought it was two!  She's doing this intentionally, she's playing mind games. [_gasp_] She's hoping to undermine my confidence, [_gasp_] so she'll have the advantage. [_gasp_]

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, but you're showin' her.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry I'm late.  What's wrong with Niles?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, he's in a tizzy 'cause Mel's late.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dear God!  She's never late!

speaker: Frasier
text: Steady Niles!

speaker: Martin
text: Nice job, Frasier.  Well, how'd things go with Donny?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I used every psychological trick in my bag to get myself added to the lawsuit.

speaker: Niles
text: That's unforgivable!

speaker: Frasier
text: Tell me about it.

speaker: Niles
text: No, that prune danish that Dad dropped down here last Thursday is still here!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I think I see Mel pullin' in.

speaker: Niles
text: Don't panic! [_He lifts his head, banging it on the table._] Thanks for the moral support.  Don't let her see you here.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_rising_] OK.  If you need us, we'll be right up there.

speaker: Niles
text: Thanks. _Martin and Frasier sit at the table around the support column, covering their faces with newspapers.  Mel walks in, wearing large, dark sunglasses._

speaker: Niles
text: Hello Mel.

speaker: Mel
text: Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Please.

speaker: Mel
text: Well, here we are: our four-day anniversary.

speaker: Niles
text: Mel, I never meant to...

speaker: Mel
text: What?  Hurt me?  If that were the case, you never would have run off with your... maid whore, leaving me holding the brochures to our honeymoon.

speaker: Niles
text: Technically, she's a physical therapist. [_off her look_] You were saying?

speaker: Mel
text: If you think that I...

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Mel. Here, here...

speaker: Mel
text: No! _She slams her hands down on the table.  Niles jumps and sends his handkerchief flying, managing to catch it.  Mel takes off her sunglasses._

speaker: Mel
text: I promised myself I wouldn't cry, damn it!  I want you to listen to me very carefully.  Last night, as I lay in bed, awake, I thought I'm either going to kill you, or I'm going to kill myself.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, here you are, so I guess that leaves, uh...

speaker: Mel
text: Will you shut up and let me finish?  I realized that wouldn't solve anything.  So, I've decided to make this as painless as possible.  You will have your divorce, Niles, and it will be quick and clean.

speaker: Niles
text: That's very generous...

speaker: Mel
text: Hold your applause, there are some conditions.  As you know, I have a certain standing in my social circle that's important to me, and having my husband of three days run off with some Cockney tart is a humiliation I'd prefer to avoid.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, I understand completely.

speaker: Mel
text: So this is how this is going to play out.  For the next few weeks, as far as rest of the world is concerned, we are still happily married.

speaker: Niles
text: Check.

speaker: Mel
text: We will appear together in public, at various social occasions.

speaker: Niles
text: Check.

speaker: Mel
text: In private, I don't want to lay eyes on you.

speaker: Niles
text: Check, check.

speaker: Mel
text: And when a suitable amount of time has passed, _I_ will file for divorce.

speaker: Niles
text: It seems like you've thought of everything.

speaker: Mel
text: I have. [_She hands him a box._] Here's the watch I was going to give you as a wedding gift.  Please wear it when we're together.

speaker: Niles
text: [_looking at it_] It's, uh... [_He peers closer._]

speaker: Mel
text: Yes, it said "Forever Yours".  I scratched it out with a screwdriver.

speaker: Niles
text: There's something else crudely carved here, but... ah.  Well, at least you were able to use that "f" from "forever".

speaker: Martin
text: Maybe it's not gonna be so bad after all, she just gave him a watch.

speaker: Frasier
text: Isn't this all too typical? [_He pulls out the plastic groom._] Niles leaves his wife for another woman, he gets a gift.  I try to do the right thing and I get Mr. Chump and a lawsuit! [_He puts the figure away._]

speaker: Martin
text: Frasier, I know you thought it was for the best, but I told you not to go see Donny, didn't I?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, you did.

speaker: Martin
text: But you went down there anyway, didn't you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I did!

speaker: Martin
text: I told you not to screw around with lawyers, didn't I?

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, Dad!

speaker: Martin
text: [_quietly_] I told him not to go down there.

speaker: Frasier
text: Will you shut up?!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, there she goes.

speaker: Martin
text: So?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Ah, well, um, all things considered, not so bad.  In exchange for a neat and tidy divorce, all I have to do is play the doting husband at some social functions for a few weeks.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, that doesn't sound so bad.

speaker: Frasier
text: What kind of social functions?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, uh, for instance, ah, tonight...is our wedding reception.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dear God!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, since we eloped, some of Mel's colleagues decided to throw a last minute get-together to toast our nuptials.
